result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel T Offutt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel T Offutt in court, in custody, with attorney Michael H. Kopp.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CT1719, Court grants the State's motion.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Daniel T Offutt in court, in custody.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant stated that he has retained attorney Michael Kopp.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
